crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
The successful initialization of the CRNRSTN Suite :: to the hosting environment depends very much on the parameters passed through the defineEnvResource() method for each target environment. For example, if your replication of the $_SERVER parameter variables are off by even a character (e.g. due to reversed slashes or neglect of case-sensitivity), the CRNRSTN Suite :: will not initialize with the correct environment...if any.
Outside of the predefined server config parameters contained within the $_SERVER[ ] super global, the defineEnvResource() method can be used to define any number of resources of interest for the purpose of providing access to said resources to the application through the CRNRSTN Suite ::.
For example, WSDL end-points, Wordpress(r) configuration parameters (if running Wordpress(r) on top of CRNRSTN), links to 3rd party resources, analytics/tracking service IDs and of course paths to assets relative to the application are just a few of the kinds of parameters which may be specific to each running environment and therefore warranted to be represented in the CRNRSTN Suite :: configuration file.
If a particular resource needs to be exposed to...and is consistent across...ALL hosting environments...localhost to production...instead of defining that resource once for each environment, simply define that resource once specifying (*) for the $envKey and the CRNRSTN Suite will apply that defined parameter to ALL environments.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.
It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of gains in security and processing efficiency.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: A user-defined custom string identifying a specific hosting environment or server profile. E.g. "LOCALHOST_MY_OLD_MAC_TOWER", "LOCALHOST_PC" or "PROD_01".
A user-defined key representing information that the application will be accessing. E.g. "ROOT_PATH_CLIENT_HTTP","SSL_ENABLED", "DOCUMENT_ROOT" or "FREEDOWNLOADLINK".
The value that should be returned to the application when the $resourceKey is provided for the retrieval of said information.
